activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#11744
activity.text:
@hrit2773 I get your point  but as you can see in the screenshots I shared  there are different print layouts depending on the content. Making all of them fully responsive especially with wide tables is quite tricky. Thatâ€™s why I feel horizontal scrolling is a more practical solution in this case. if  we  add horizontal scrolling then we dont have to change  so much just have to add `overflow-x-auto` only at the place where i am using the <Page> component in PrintPreview  component. Open to ideas if there's a better way!
scrrenshot :

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/66e061c1-11b0-493b-abbd-405f28007d28)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b9ed137c-3b52-4404-93be-bc3721f6c660)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/da634826-6a62-4824-a3b0-bd41879feb90)

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#11266
activity.text:
@Jacobjeevan  @rithviknishad  Sir, when navigating to the appointment tab of a patient through an organization, we do not have the facility id, which prevents us from viewing the appointment details when clicking on "View" in the appointment list. currently, fetching appointment details requires both the facility id and the appointment id. However, since we access the patient through an organization, the facility id is missing.

To resolve this, we have two possible approaches:

1. Backend Modification: Update the backend to allow fetching appointment details using either the facility id or the organization id. although it is not a good approach.
2. Frontend Adjustment: When clicking on a patient card to navigate to the Patient Details page, we can redirect to the following URL format: /facility/{facility_id}/patient/{patient_id} instead of: /patient/{patient_id}  . but this also need one backend modification that when we  send data  of patients in  while patients tab we also have to include facility id  so that we add that facility id in the route .  i think second approach will be better  form first   as it  need less change in backend .
3. If modifying the backend or frontend is not feasible, we can disable the "View" button when accessing the appointment tab through the organization route  to preventing users from attempting to fetch appointment details without a facility id.

 if this is valid issue then i want to work on this issue . although only these approch come in my mind  currently  .but if there is other approch please let me know .

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#11266

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#11167
activity.text:
@Jacobjeevan  sir i  have implemented text wrapping by removing line-clamp-2, and it works properly when the sentence consists of normal words. but one problem coming when,  someone adds a long single word, it doesnâ€™t wrap correctly. although generally no one can add long single words but if want to  handle that case also then, I have to used 'break-all whitespace-normal' also in p tag.

 i have attached the screenshot of normal long description and long single word description :

normal long description
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a5828469-1f95-418a-92ac-d3f2a221855d)

long single word description:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/0e875853-5b4c-45f0-9528-774bbd8638af)
 so if i use 'break-all whitespace-normal'  long single word description also wrap properly but it break the long word .

so  tell  me is i have to use 'break-all whitespace-normal' or not . Mostly time no one write single word description.

activity.title: ohcnetwork/care_fe#11167
activity.text:
@Jacobjeevan  proposed Solution:
                        - we can truncate long department descriptions 
                        - add a "Read More" button to expand the full description.
                        -ensure proper text wrapping to prevent layout issues
                Expected Timeline:- 1 day
